characters.name: Apollo Justice
characters.description1: A lawyer who's been at the agency since before I joined. He has an amazing ability to spot lies through people's tells.

characters.name: Phoenix Wright
characters.description1: The lawyer who owns the agency. I owe him for giving me the chance to become a full-fledged lawyer.

characters.name: Trucy Wright
characters.description1: Mr. Wright's darling daughter. She wants to be a famous magician someday.

characters.name: Aristotle Means
characters.description1: A lawyer course professor at the academy. His smile is somewhat scary.
characters.description2: A lawyer course professor at the academy. His smile is somewhat scary, as is his educational policy.

characters.name: Constance Courte
characters.description1: The professor who invited Mr. Wright to the academy. She is a judge course teacher, but she's not very punctual.
characters.description2: The professor who invited Mr. Wright here. She was a judge course teacher until she became the victim of this case.

characters.name: Juniper Woods
characters.description1: A senior in the judge course. She's a good friend, and I've known her since childhood.

characters.name: Hugh O'Conner
characters.description1: A senior in the lawyer course who served as the defense in the mock trial. He seems like kind of a jerk.
characters.description2: A senior in the lawyer course who served as the defense in the mock trial. He took seven years off from school at one point.

characters.name: Robin Newman
characters.description1: A senior in the prosecutor course who served as the prosecution in the mock trial. He tends to shout at people.
characters.description2: A senior in the prosecutor course who served as the prosecution in the mock trial. "He" is really a "she" who'd rather be an artist.

characters.name: Bobby Fulbright
characters.description1: The lively detective in charge of this case. He makes you wonder what justice is really all about.

characters.name: Simon Blackquill
characters.description1: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.

characters.name: Klavier Gavin
characters.description1: Mr. Rock Star Prosecutor himself, he was the leader and vocalist of the Gavinners.

characters.name: Myriam Scuttlebutt
characters.description1: A senior in the judge course. She is the aloof editor-in-chief of the school paper who walks around with a box over her head.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My brand-new, shiny badge. It shows that I'm a lawyer.

evidences.name: Arrow
evidences.description1: The arrow that pierced the victim's side. It's stained with blood.

evidences.name: Courte's Planner
evidences.description1: Constance Courte's planner. A sword emblem is printed on the cover and on each page.

evidences.name: Themis Herald
evidences.description1: A school paper with a malicious scoop on an alleged love triangle involving Junie.

evidences.name: Stage Costume
evidences.description1: A costume Junie was supposed to wear. It has a glowing star pattern. (With notes, 2 pages.)

evidences.name: Mock Trial Script
evidences.description1: A top secret script written by Junie. There's only one copy. (4 pages.)

evidences.name: Themis Herald Extra
evidences.description1: An extra edition of the school paper that covers the mock trial.

evidences.name: Awl
evidences.description1: The weapon used to murder Constance Courte. Her blood was found on it along with Junie's fingerprints.

evidences.name: Courte's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Est. time of death: Between 6 and 8 PM. Cause of death: Blood loss from a deep stab wound in the victim's side.

evidences.name: Tape Recorder
evidences.description1: Used by Myriam to secretly record the conversation in the art room. A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!"
evidences.description2: A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" Recorded in the art room at 7:10 PM on the 23rd.
evidences.description3: The voice on the tape says "You're a goner!" just like in Junie's script. It may be a fake.
evidences.description4: The voice on the tape says "You're a goner!" just like in Junie's script. It's been identified as a fake.
evidences.description5: Identified as a fake. Prof. Means used Hugh to pass it on to the police.

evidences.name: Glowing Costume Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of the stage costume taken in a dark room. A coat of fluorescent paint made it glow.

evidences.name: School Camera Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of the art room while preparations were being made. Taken on the day of the murder.

evidences.name: School Banner
evidences.description1: A large banner that was hung by a wire between the stage and art room. A trace amount of blood was found on it.

evidences.name: Purple Fragment → Purple Fragments
evidences.description1: A purple fragment from a broken statue. It was found all alone in the strangest of places.
evidences.description2: Two purple fragments of a broken statue. Going to search for more.
evidences.description3: Three purple fragments of a broken statue that originally stood on a pedestal onstage.

evidences.name: White Fragment → White Fragments
evidences.description1: A large, white fragment. It has a distinctive shape that could be described as angular.
evidences.description2: Two large, white fragments. It looks like it would feel good to break them.

evidences.name: Lady Justice
evidences.description1: This and the statue of Klavier were broken at the same time, but have been repaired. No one knows where it came from.
evidences.description2: It was found broken onstage. Professor Courte had remade it into a completely different-looking statue the day before the mock trial.

evidences.name: "Hugh" Scrap
evidences.description1: Discovered onstage, it appears to be a piece of paper torn from a notebook. The name "Hugh" is written on it.

evidences.name: Burnt Fragments
evidences.description1: The burnt remnants of the Gavinners banner that was tossed into the incinerator and later found by Myriam.

evidences.name: Stage Set Up Photos
evidences.description1: The last two of Myriam's photos. They show the students setting up the stage's backdrop on the night of the murder. (2 photos.)

evidences.name: Voiceprint Analysis
evidences.description1: The results of the voice analysis performed on the tape recording.

evidences.name: Lecture Hall Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram of the lecture hall where the mock trial took place.
